intro: Clavija boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian clavija, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and sometimes edible roots. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
